metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5362 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The IPTables firewall in OpenStack Neutron before 7.0.4 and 8.0.0 through 8.1.0 allows remote attackers to bypass an intended DHCP-spoofing protection mechanism and consequently cause a denial of service or intercept network traffic via a crafted DHCP discovery message.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5362` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

neutron-bgp-dragent - 2:8.4.0-0ubuntu4
neutron-common - 2:8.4.0-0ubuntu4
neutron-dhcp-agent - 2:8.4.0-0ubuntu4
neutron-l3-agent - 2:8.4.0-0ubuntu4
neutron-linuxbridge-agent - 2:8.4.0-0ubuntu4
neutron-macvtap-agent - 2:8.4.0-0ubuntu4
neutron-metadata-agent - 2:8.4.0-0ubuntu4
neutron-metering-agent - 2:8.4.0-0ubuntu4
neutron-openvswitch-agent - 2:8.4.0-0ubuntu4
neutron-plugin-linuxbridge-agent - 2:8.4.0-0ubuntu4
neutron-plugin-ml2 - 2:8.4.0-0ubuntu4
neutron-plugin-openvswitch-agent - 2:8.4.0-0ubuntu4
neutron-plugin-sriov-agent - 2:8.4.0-0ubuntu4
neutron-server - 2:8.4.0-0ubuntu4
neutron-sriov-agent - 2:8.4.0-0ubuntu4
python-neutron - 2:8.4.0-0ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: neutron package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:8.4.0-0ubuntu4').
